subtasks: Identify the location of the spill
Retrieve the spill kit containing sand or sawdust
Deploy sand or sawdust to contain the liquid spill immediately
Absorb the liquid spill using sand or sawdust
Prevent the spill from spreading by containing it
Avoid contaminating other surfaces
If the spill is on the ground, prevent it from penetrating below the surface
Scoop up the contaminated material using appropriate tools
Place the contaminated material into a plastic bag
Seal the plastic bag containing the contaminated material
Label the sealed plastic bag for safe disposal
Wait for further instructions or proper disposal
For more information on pesticide use and PPE, visit www.cdc.gov.au

tasks.task: Alternatively, the entire process of dealing with a pesticide spill could be considered an MAINTASK with various subtasks, including recognizing danger, using the right tools, performing the cleanup, and then seeking more info if needed. But the main task is dealing with the spill.

So, in summary, after carefully going through the transcript and breaking down the instructions, the MAINTASK is "Contaminated Area Cleanup," with steps on how to identify, contain, absorb, collect, and properly dispose of the contaminated material.

subtasks: Identify the location of the spill
Retrieve the spill kit containing sand or sawdust
Deploy sand or sawdust to contain the liquid spill immediately
Absorb the liquid spill using sand or sawdust
Prevent the spill from spreading by containing it
Avoid contaminating other surfaces
If on the ground, prevent penetration below the surface
Scoop up the contaminated material using appropriate tools
Place the contaminated material into a plastic bag
Seal the plastic bag containing the contaminated material
Label the sealed plastic bag for safe disposal
For more information on pesticide use and PPE, visit www.cdc.gov.au
